ArticleTitle.sentence: NF-AT activation induced by a CAML-interacting member of the tumor necrosis factor receptor superfamily.

event.clue: NF-AT activation induced by a CAML-interacting member of the tumor necrosis factor receptor superfamily.

AbstractText.sentence: Activation of the nuclear factor of activated T cells transcription factor (NF-AT) is a key event underlying lymphocyte action.

event.clue: Activation of the nuclear factor of activated T cells transcription factor (NF-AT) is a key event underlying lymphocyte action.
Activation of the nuclear factor of activated T cells transcription factor (NF-AT) is a key event underlying lymphocyte action.

AbstractText.sentence: The CAML (calcium-modulator and cyclophilin ligand) protein is a coinducer of NF-AT activation when overexpressed in Jurkat T cells.

event.clue: The CAML (calcium-modulator and cyclophilin ligand) protein is a coinducer of NF-AT activation when overexpressed in Jurkat T cells.
The CAML (calcium-modulator and cyclophilin ligand) protein is a coinducer of NF-AT activation when overexpressed in Jurkat T cells.

AbstractText.sentence: A member of the tumor necrosis factor receptor superfamily was isolated by virtue of its affinity for CAML.

event.clue: A member of the tumor necrosis factor receptor superfamily was isolated by virtue of its affinity for CAML.

AbstractText.sentence: Cross-linking of this lymphocyte-specific protein, designated TACI (transmembrane activator and CAML-interactor), on the surface of transfected Jurkat cells with TACI-specific antibodies led to activation of the transcription factors NF-AT, AP-1, and NFkappaB.

event.clue: Cross-linking of this lymphocyte-specific protein, designated TACI (transmembrane activator and CAML-interactor), on the surface of transfected Jurkat cells with TACI-specific antibodies led to activation of the transcription factors NF-AT, AP-1, and NFkappaB.

AbstractText.sentence: TACI-induced activation of NF-AT was specifically blocked by a dominant-negative CAML mutant, thus implicating CAML as a signaling intermediate.

event.clue: TACI-induced activation of NF-AT was specifically blocked by a dominant-negative CAML mutant, thus implicating CAML as a signaling intermediate.
